text: The Final 2016 Men's Olympic Qualification Tournament for rugby sevens at the 2016 Summer Olympics was held on 18 and 19 June 2016 at Stade Louis II in Fontvieille, Monaco The tournament used a round-robin format. The qualification tournament was won by Spain, as a result, they qualified for the Olympics 2016. == Teams == {| class="wikitable" width=900 |- ! width=41%|Means of qualification !! width=18%|Completed date !! width=19%|Venue !! width=5%|Berths !! width=17%|Qualified |- | rowspan="2"|2015 CONSUR Sevens || rowspan="2"| 7 June 2015 || rowspan="2" | Santa Fe || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | rowspan="2"|2015 NACRA Sevens || rowspan="2"| 14 June 2015 || rowspan="2" | Cary || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | |2015 Rugby Europe Sevens Grand Prix Series || 12 July 2015 || Various || align=center| 1 || |- | rowspan="3"|2015 Rugby Europe Sevens Olympic Repechage Tournament ||rowspan="3"| 19 July 2015 || rowspan="3"| Lisbon ||rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- | rowspan="3"|2015 ARFU Men's Sevens Championships || rowspan="3"| 8 November 2015 || rowspan="3" | Hong Kong || rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- | rowspan="2"|2015 Oceania Sevens Championship || rowspan="2"| 15 November 2015 || rowspan="2" | Auckland || rowspan="2" align=center| 2 || |- | |- | rowspan="3"|2015 Africa Cup Sevens || rowspan="3"| 15 November 2015 || rowspan="3" | Johannesburg || rowspan="3" align=center| 3 || |- | |- | |- ! colspan=3|Total !! 16 !! |} ==Format== The teams are drawn into four pools, each containing four teams. *The top two teams in each pool advance to the Cup stage. The team that wins the Cup qualifies for the Olympic Games. **The losers of the Cup quarter-finals play off for the Plate . *The bottom two teams in each pool go into the Bowl. **The losers of the Plate quarter-finals play off for the Shield. ==Pool Stage== ===Pool A=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width="245"|Teams !width="40"|Pld !width="40"|W !width="40"|D
